FuncDef:
The display mpls lsp command displays information about LSPs.
The display mpls lsp compatible command displays information about LSPs.
CLIs: display mpls lsp [ outgoing-interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } ] [ lsr-role { ingress | transit | egress } ] [ verbose ]
display mpls lsp compatible [ outgoing-interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } ] [ lsr-role { ingress | transit | egress } ]
display mpls lsp nexthop <nexthop> [ lsr-role { ingress | transit | egress } ] [ verbose ]
display mpls lsp vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> [ outgoing-interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } ] [ lsr-role { ingress | transit | egress } ] [ verbose ]
display mpls lsp vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> include <ip-address> <mask-length> verbose
display mpls lsp vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> exclude <ip-address> <mask-length> verbose
display mpls lsp vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> nexthop <nexthop> [ lsr-role { ingress | transit | egress } ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about all LSPs with a specified outbound interface.
-

Displays information about all LSPs on the current LSR that plays a specified role.
-

Displays information about all LSPs on the current LSR that functions as the ingress.
-

Displays information about all LSPs on the current LSR that functions as a transit node.
-

Displays information about all LSPs on the current LSR that functions as the egress.
-

Displays information about LSPs that are mapped to a specified FEC.
-

Displays information about LSPs with a specified destination IP address.
-

Specifies the mask length of an IP address. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.
-

Displays information about LSPs that are not mapped to a specified FEC.
-

Displays information about all LSPs with a specified next hop.
-

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters.

Examples: Flag after Out IF: (I) - RLFA Iterated LSP, (I*) - Normal and RLFA Iterated LSP
Flag after LDP FRR: (L) - Logic FRR LSP
FEC                In/Out Label    In/Out IF                      Vrf Name
Flag after Out IF: (I) - RLFA Iterated LSP, (I*) - Normal and RLFA Iterated LSP
Flag after LDP FRR: (L) - Logic FRR LSP
FEC                In/Out Label    In/Out IF                      Vrf Name
Flag after Out IF: (I) - RLFA Iterated LSP, (I*) - Normal and RLFA Iterated LSP
Flag after LDP FRR: (L) - Logic FRR LSP
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If no parameter is configured, the display mpls lsp command displays information about all LSPs.
If BGP LSPs load-balance traffic, this command output contains only optimal outbound interface information of routes. To query all outbound interface information used in BGP LSP ECMP, query the BGP or IP routing table.
